item.title: 蒂森克虏伯钢铁部门与工会就重组达成总协议
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯钢铁部门周三表示，已与 IG Metall 工会就德国最大钢铁制造商的重组计划达成原则性协议，并表示其目标是避免强制裁员。【原文：Thyssenkrupp's steel unit said on Wednesday that it has reached an agreement in principle with the IG Metall union around the planned restructuring of Germany's largest steel maker, adding its aim was to avoid forced layoffs.】

item.title: 美国关税和欧洲经济放缓重塑全球太阳能电池板贸易
item.description: 贸易数据显示，在包括柬埔寨和泰国在内的其他东南亚国家的出口受到大幅关税打击后，老挝和印度尼西亚的太阳能电池板制造商（大部分为中国企业所有）提高了它们在美国市场的份额。【原文：Solar panel makers in Laos and Indonesia, mostly owned by Chinese firms, boosted their share in the U.S. market after steep tariffs hit exports from other Southeast Asian countries including Cambodia and Thailand, trade data showed.】

item.title: 汇丰银行为美国客户启动特朗普关税支付程序
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）于4月2日征收全面关税，引起了包括中国在内的其他国家的报复，汇丰银行为美国客户推出了一项新的融资工具，用于支付进口关税。【原文：HSBC has launched a new financing tool for U.S. clients to pay import duties following the imposition of sweeping tariffs by President Donald Trump on April 2, which drew retaliation from other countries including China.】

item.title: EA 因乐观预测和《战地》发布而股价大涨
item.description: 电子艺界（Electronic Arts）的股票在盘前交易中上涨了近 5%，此前这家游戏巨头的乐观预测缓解了市场对其发展势头放缓的担忧，并恢复了人们对其体育大片的信心。【原文：Shares of Electronic Arts rose nearly 5% in premarket trading, after the gaming giant's upbeat forecast eased concerns about slowing momentum and revived confidence in its blockbuster sports titles.】

item.title: 数据分析产品需求旺盛，Verisk 盈利超出预期
item.description: Verisk Analytics 周三公布的第一季度利润好于预期，主要原因是财产和意外（P&C）保险公司用于评估保单风险的数据分析产品需求旺盛。【原文：Verisk Analytics reported a better-than-expected profit for the first quarter on Wednesday, driven by demand for its data analytics products primarily used by property and casualty (P&C) insurers to assess policy risks.】

item.title: 独家报道福特以关税为由提高墨西哥生产车型的价格
item.description: 福特汽车公司将从5月2日起提高其在墨西哥生产的三款车型的价格，成为继美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收关税后首批调整贴纸价格的主要汽车制造商之一。【原文：Ford Motor is hiking prices on three of its Mexico-produced models effective May 2, becoming one of the first major automakers to adjust sticker prices following U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.】

item.title: 部长称，随着人工智能应用的增长，英国将面临更多网络攻击
item.description: 英国高级部长帕特-麦克法登（Pat McFadden）周三表示，人工智能的发展将增加对英国的网络攻击的数量和复杂程度。【原文：The growth of AI will increase the number and sophistication of cyberattacks on Britain, senior minister Pat McFadden said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 罗克韦尔自动化上调年度利润预期，股价大涨
item.description: 罗克韦尔自动化公司（Rockwell Automation）在第二季度削减成本帮助提高了利润率之后，周三上调了年度利润预期，使其股价在盘前交易中上涨了近 8%。【原文：Rockwell Automation raised its annual profit forecast on Wednesday after cost cuts helped boost margins in the second quarter, sending its shares up nearly 8% in premarket trade.】

item.title: Netflix 将改造电视应用界面，为 iOS 用户推出人工智能搜索功能
item.description: Netflix 周三表示，它计划改造其电视应用程序界面，并在 iOS 移动平台上引入生成式人工智能，允许用户用自然和日常语言询问内容。【原文：Netflix said on Wednesday it plans to revamp its TV app interface and introduce generative AI to the iOS mobile platform, allowing users to ask for content in natural and everyday language.】

item.title: 产品需求强劲，Trimble 季度收入超出预期
item.description: 本周三，Trimble 第一季度营收超出华尔街预期，得益于在经济不确定的情况下对其导航设备和软件服务的强劲需求。【原文：Trimble beat Wall Street expectations for first-quarter revenue on Wednesday, benefiting from robust demand for its navigation equipment and software services despite economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 独家报道北欧和爱沙尼亚计划在网络中断时提供离线银行卡支付备份
item.description: 芬兰银行董事会成员图奥马斯-瓦利马基（Tuomas Valimaki）周三表示，芬兰、瑞典、挪威、丹麦和爱沙尼亚正计划推出离线银行卡支付系统，以便在网络连接中断（包括因破坏造成的网络连接中断）时提供备份。【原文：Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Estonia are planning to roll out a system of offline card payments to provide a back-up if internet connections are lost, including due to sabotage, Bank of Finland board member Tuomas Valimaki said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 梯瓦制药第一季度利润增幅高于预期
item.description: 梯瓦制药工业公司（Teva Pharmaceutical Industries）公布的第一季度利润增幅略高于预期，这主要得益于其治疗偏头痛、亨廷顿氏症和精神分裂症的三种品牌药物的强劲销售增长。【原文：Teva Pharmaceutical Industries reported a slightly larger than expected rise in first-quarter profit, helped by strong sales gains in a trio of its branded drugs to treat migraines, Huntington's disease and schizophrenia.】

item.title: CrowdStrike 将裁员 5%，重申业绩预测
item.description: CrowdStrike reiterated its fiscal 2026 first quarter and annual forecasts on Wednesday and announced a plan to cut about 500 roles, roughly 5% of its workforce, to reduce costs.

item.title: 纽约时报》预测季度订阅收入增长高于预期
item.description: 纽约时报》周三预测第二季度订阅收入的增长将超过华尔街的预期，该报押注于捆绑产品的强劲需求。【原文：The New York Times forecast second-quarter subscription revenue growth above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, betting on strong demand for its bundled offerings.】

item.title: 亚马逊的贝索斯领导对人工智能数据公司 Toloka 的新投资
item.description: 杰夫-贝索斯（Jeff Bezos）的个人公司贝索斯探险公司（Bezos Expeditions）正牵头向人工智能数据解决方案公司 Toloka 投资 7200 万美元，Toloka 周三告诉路透社，该公司正寻求扩大业务规模。【原文：Jeff Bezos' personal firm Bezos Expeditions is leading a $72-million investment in artificial intelligence data solutions company Toloka, which is looking to scale up its business, Toloka told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 英国 FD Technologies 因可能被私募股权公司以 7.22 亿美元收购而大涨
item.description: 英国数据和分析公司 FD Technologies 周三表示，正在与美国私募股权公司 TA Associates 就可能的收购要约进行深入谈判，该公司的估值为 5.416 亿英镑（7.2277 亿美元）。【原文：British data and analytics firm FD Technologies said on Wednesday it is in advanced talks with American private equity firm TA Associates over a possible acquisition offer, valuing the firm at 541.6 million pounds ($722.77 million).】

item.title: 优步预计第二季度业绩乐观，乘车和快递需求稳定
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）周三预测，第二季度调整后的核心利润和总预订量基本高于华尔街预期，这表明其打车和送餐服务的需求具有弹性。【原文：Uber Technologies forecast second-quarter adjusted core profit and gross bookings largely above Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, indicating resilient demand for its ride-hailing and food delivery services.】

item.title: 美国乐园和流媒体推动迪士尼盈利超出预期
item.description: 华特迪士尼的季度业绩超出了华尔街的预期，原因是今年前三个月美国主题公园的游客增加了消费，而且该公司的 Disney+ 流媒体用户也意外增加。【原文：Walt Disney's quarterly results topped Wall Street expectations as visitors to its U.S. theme parks increased spending in the first three months of the year and the company saw an unexpected rise in Disney+ streaming customers.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，沃尔沃汽车公司因后视摄像头问题召回逾 40 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）表示，瑞典汽车制造商沃尔沃汽车公司因后视摄像头问题在美国召回413151辆汽车。【原文：Swedish automaker Volvo Cars is recalling 413,151 vehicles in the United States over an issue with the rearview camera, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said.】

item.title: 预计电费将上涨，Equinix 马来西亚分公司关注替代能源选择
item.description: 数据中心公司 Equinix 的马来西亚分部周三表示，由于预计国内电价即将上调将增加其成本，该公司正在考察各种替代能源供应商。【原文：The Malaysian unit of data centre firm Equinix said on Wednesday it is looking at various providers of alternative energy as it expects an impending increase in domestic electricity tariffs to raise its costs.】

item.title: 加工利润率高企，邦吉第一季度利润超出预期
item.description: 邦吉公司（Bunge）周三公布的第一季度利润超出华尔街预期，原因是谷物贸易商和加工商受益于较高的加工利润率和关税不确定性推动的产品需求。【原文：Bunge beat Wall Street expectations for first-quarter profit on Wednesday as the grain trader and processor benefited from higher processing margins and tariff uncertainty-fueled demand for its products.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行股东大会再引反以抗议
item.description: 在周三举行的年度会议上，巴克莱面临着投资者对其股价表现和关闭分支机构等问题的激烈质询，会议还引起了反对巴克莱涉嫌向以色列国防公司提供金融服务的活动人士的新抗议。【原文：Barclays faced ill-tempered questions from investors about its share price performance and branch closures at its annual meeting on Wednesday, which also drew fresh protests from activists opposed to its alleged provision of financial services to Israeli defence firms.】

item.title: 欧盟起诉多个国家未妥善执行《数字服务法
item.description: 欧盟委员会在一份声明中说，它已决定将捷克共和国、西班牙、塞浦路斯、波兰和葡萄牙告上欧盟法院，因为它们未能有效执行《数字服务法》（DSA）。【原文：The European Commission said in a statement it had decided to take the Czech Republic, Spain, Cyprus, Poland and Portugal to the Court of Justice of the European Union for failing to implement the Digital Services Act (DSA) effectively.】

item.title: 美股期货因中国贸易降级希望而上涨；美联储受到关注
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货反弹，因为与中国政府的贸易紧张局势有望缓和，而美联储正在举行的货币政策会议仍是焦点。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rebounded on Wednesday as hopes of a de-escalation in trade tensions with Beijing firmed, while the Federal Reserve's ongoing monetary policy meeting remained in focus.】

item.title: 早间竞标贸易谈判终于开始
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 消息人士称，Grab 希望在第二季度达成收购印度尼西亚 GoTo 公司的交易
item.description: 两位知情人士透露，在美国上市的打车和送餐公司Grab正寻求在第二季度达成收购印尼较小竞争对手GoTo的交易。【原文：U.S.-listed ride-hailing and food delivery firm Grab is looking to strike a deal to take over smaller Indonesian rival GoTo in the second quarter, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 美国旅游需求下滑对低成本航空公司打击最大
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战导致旅游需求下滑，这让美国所有航空公司都陷入困境，但廉价航空公司的痛苦最为严重。【原文：A slump in travel demand due to President Donald Trump's trade war has left all U.S. airlines reeling, but the pain is most acute at budget carriers.】

item.title: 美股在关税反弹后面临估值上升、盈利前景不明等问题
item.description: 美国股市在经历了关税引发的暴跌之后，投资者对阻碍市场在短期内取得更显著涨幅的障碍保持警惕。【原文：After a round-trip for U.S. stocks following their tariff-fueled swoon, investors are wary of obstacles that will prevent the market from more significant gains in the near term.】

item.title: 贸易政策混乱，投资者期待软数据指引方向
item.description: 由于具体的官方指标在瞬息万变的环境中很快就会过时，美国贸易政策的摇摆不定正迫使一些投资者更多地依赖传闻数据来帮助他们做出决策。【原文：Whipsawing U.S. trade policies are forcing some investors to lean more on anecdotal data to help them make decisions, as concrete official indicators become out-of-date too quickly in the rapidly changing environment.】

item.title: 美联储可能维持利率不变，以寻求经济的清晰度
item.description: 美联储官员表示，在决定下一步利率行动之前，他们希望对美国经济的走向有一个更清晰的认识，但由于贸易和其他政策仍未确定，央行上次会议以来的数据使得前景可以说更加扑朔迷离。【原文：Federal Reserve officials say they want a clearer picture of the U.S. economy's direction before deciding their next interest rate move, but data since the central bank's last meeting have made the outlook arguably even more confusing as trade and other policies remain unsettled.】
